column29: Protocols: Arabidopsis thaliana Col-0 were grown in a gnotobiotic microbox system as described in Innerebner et al. 2011. Briefly, microboxes containing 70 ml MS medium including vitamins (Duchefa) supplemented with 3% sucrose and 0.55% plant agar (Duchefa) were prepared. The medium was covered with a sterile gas-permeable foil (lumox film 25, Sarstedt) containing 8 holes (4 mm diameter) and boxes were UV-irradiated for 20 min. Seeds were surface sterilized and placed on the agar surface at the positions of the 8 holes. Seeds were inoculated with as described in Innerebner et al. 2011. Plants were grown in a growth chamber set to 22°C with 16 h light/8 h dark cycle for the first week followed by 9h light/15 h dark cycle.  "One day before infection with Pseudomonas syringae pv. tomato DC3000 luxCDABE (Fan et al. 2008, The Plant Journal 53:393-399), 30 holes were pierced into the microbox walls with a canula (BIBRAUN, 18G x 1.5\"", ø 1.2 x 40 mm) to reduce relative humidity to roughly 80%. One loop of a two-day Pst lux culture on King's B (KB) plate was suspended in 1 ml 10 mM MgCl2. 150 μl were plated onto a KB plate and incubated overnight at 28°C to grow the infection inoculum. For preparation of the infection suspension, 10 ml 10 mM MgCl2 were spread on the plate and after 10 minutes the suspension was transferred to a 50 ml falcon tube. The concentration was adjusted turbidimetrically to an OD600 of 0.1 and further diluted 1:100 to an OD600 of 0....
